citation.article-title: Legionella moravica sp. nov. and Legionella brunensis sp. nov. isolated from cooling-tower water.

p.s: Description of Legionella brunensis sp. nov.
Legionella brunensis (bru.nen'sis, L. gen. n. brunensis coming from Brno, Czechoslovakia)
Legionella brunensis is a Gram-negative, catalase-positive rod which produces beta-lactamase and does not hydrolyse hippurate.
Its biochemical reactions are typical of the genus Legionella described above.
Its cellular fatty acids are predominately branch-chained.
It is serologically different from other described Legionella species.
The type strain of L. brunensis is 441-1 (ATCC 43878, CDC 1635-CZK-E), which has a G+C content of 40.5 mol%.
It is isolated from cooling-tower water.
